chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge.  To be paid by 9/12/2016. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: per order dated March 18, 2016, the deadline for Link to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal in this matter is extended to May 16, 2016.

records.addlTxt: Per conversations with the court reports that took the plea and the sentencing, both Judges referred to the case as a misdemeanor.  On the date of sentencing the charge was referred to on the record as a misdemeanor defense.
Back to court. Need clarification on the record, what is the severity, misdmeanor/Felony?

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in custody. Benjamin Verhulst for Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements by: Jessica G.

Court ordered the Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.

Court ordered the Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge by 09/12/2016. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief and letter from the victim recieved and filed.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Due to branch 4 in trial, Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to Branch 38 on 9-10-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Repeater Enhancer 939.62(1)(b).  

AS TO CHARGE (without repeater enhancer 939.62(1)(b): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-21-2015 at 1:30 pm.    mld
Plea date scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea hearing.  Case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 4.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
Clerk:  jms
COURT ORDERED THAT IF DEFENDANT IS GRANTED HUBER RELEASE, BAIL WOULD CONVERT BACK TO CASH BAIL.   mld
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.   mld

Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-23-2015 at 1:30 pm.   Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges and assessments.  Court finds this DNA may be eligible for expungement if applies.  mld

Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in custody.  Kristin Schrank for Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
   Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CM3166 that are attached to the complaint. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Justin Joliff. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Arraignment scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case spinned to Prelim Court for Preliminary Hearing.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JESSICA G.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Montrelle Dwayne Link in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
